attributes.action: Enforce  'No dog's allowed' park areas making this safer for our children.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that there should be 'Dog Free' parks or designated areas within parks designed purely for families allowing children to play freely at minimal risk, there should be more presence with park wardens patrolling and being able to enforce heavier on the spot fines for owners allowing their dogs free from leads and fouling.
attributes.background: Parks and play areas in and around Havering becoming more susceptible to Dog owners abusing  'No Dog' areas. Increased level of dogs off leads & dog's mess around areas where children should be able to play safely and securely without being exposed to a potentially dangerous risk to their health.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local parks are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
